description:
The NeonSearch component is equivalent to an HTML <input type="search"> element. It is useful as an alternative to NeonSelect to provide filtered results when the universe of results is very large and/or the results need to be requested from a server side API.

NeonSearch provides input chips in the case the search allows multiple selection.

props.name: value
props.description:
Either a string indicating the key of the selected option ('' if there is no selection) or an array of selected
NeonSearchOption in the case when multiple = true (necessary to display them as chips).

props.name: placeholder
props.description: Placeholder to display in search input when there is no search string entered.

props.name: size
props.description: The size of the dropdown - Small, Medium or Large.

events.name: input
events.description: emitted when the user changes the selection.

events.name: filter-changed
events.description: emitted when the user types in filter box.

slots.name: option
slots.description:
provide a custom template for an option.
Bindings: option (NeonSearchOption). This slot is purely for formatting the option, all accessibility actions still apply.
